verbs.description: suavify (third-person singular simple present suavifies, present participle suavifying, simple past and past participle suavified)

entries.meaning: (rare, transitive) To make affable or suave.
examples: But 'mid the cheer, so rich in all its shapes,  Nothing the Host so valued as his grapes.  Good humour reign'd—they pleas'd the Laird—  (Eating much tends to suavify the mood)
